author: Staff Reporter
text:
Two young women who took a cab from Koramangala to their residence on Monday night had a harrowing time when the cab driver drove to a secluded spot to meet some ‘friends’.

Facebook post

The father of one of the women, Mark Rego, posted the details on Facebook on Tuesday.

“Halfway through, at a very secluded, dark place next to the Hosur Road Cemetery/Baldwin Boys School, he abruptly stopped the car and got out where 2 other cars were waiting and proceeded to have a conversation with the six to eight men. My daughter actually questioned him four times as to why he was stopping in this place, he refused to answer her,” Mr. Rego says.

When one of the women called up her dad, the driver resumed the trip but the women were horrified on realising that the unidentified men were following their cab. On the advice of her father, the women got off at a hotel on M.G. Road instead of their destination.

Meanwhile, Mr. Rego left in his car to fetch the women.

Threatened

Mr. Rego later called the cab driver, Ravi B., and questioned his behaviour. In reply, the driver allegedly abused him and threatened to bring other cab drivers to his house to ‘teach him a lesson’.

Complaint

Mr. Rego has lodged a complaint with the cab firm.
title: Women panic as cabbie stops to meet ‘friends’
